post_text:
Seniors:
Please take a senior picture with your cap and gown. Your background must be tasteful, but only a picture of you, the graduating senior. No filters will be allowed. Please email it to Ms. Guerrero by May 15, 2020 at 5:00 p.m. You do not have to have them professionally done. A friend or family member can take your picture for you. These pictures will be used in the graduation program. The picture format should be a JPG format. I look forward to getting your pictures.
Ms. Guerrero
Lguerrero@lcnas.org

PED: Schools Remain Closed, Students to Finish School Year with Remote Learning

Following the State of New Mexico Public Education Department announced Friday that schools will remain closed for the remainder of the year, New America School-Las Cruces administrators and teachers are working to release an education plan to begin on April 13.

post_text:
STATEWIDE SCHOOL CLOSURES TO BEGIN MARCH 16
In an effort to contain COVID-19, Coronavirus, the New Mexico Public Education Department (NMPED) issued a statewide closure of schools effective Monday, March 16. Students will be allowed to return to school Monday, April 6, 2020.
New America School-Las Cruces is planning on making grab-and-go lunches available to ensure students have meals.
More information will be released as soon as it becomes available.

America Cruces
May 2, 2019 at 6:52 PM ¬∑

Do you like to shop? Are you interested in supporting a worthy cause? If you answered "yes" to either of these questions, you're invited to the New America School for a giant garage sale on Saturday, May 11th. All the proceeds from this event will help send two of our students to UCLA this summer for a leadership conference. Put the date on your calendar! We're located at 207 S. Main St., Las Cruces.

shared_text:
America Cruces
March 25, 2019 at 3:12 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to Miya Torres (l) and Angelica Bolanos (r) who were selected to participate in the Ambassador Leaders International Summit (June 27-July 3, 2019) in Los Angeles. During the summit, Miya and Angelica will live on the UCLA campus and participate in community service projects, learn leadership and problem solving skills, get tips on public speaking, and more. The girls are responsible for raising funds ($3,000 each) to cover the cost of this educational experience. They have held fundraisers and solicited local businesses for donations. They have received support from many in the Las Cruces community, including a $250 donation from Steinborn Realty. If you'd like to lend your support to this educational opportunity, please contact the New America School-Las Cruces.

During the summit, Miya and Angelica will live on the UCLA campus and participate in community service projects, learn leadership and problem solving skills, get tips on public speaking, and more. The girls are responsible for raising funds ($3,000 each) to cover the cost of this educational experience. They have held fundraisers and solicited local businesses for donations. They have received support from many in the Las Cruces community, including a $250 donation from Steinborn Realty. If you'd like to lend your support to this educational opportunity, please contact the New America School-Las Cruces.

This is Paul Pacheco and his wife Tanya. Paul dropped out of high school to work and raise his kids. After his kids graduated high school, he decided it was his turn. He went back to school in his 30‚Äôs and earned his high school diploma, and is now on his way to becoming a certified welder. SB1 and HB5‚Äôs age cap wouldn‚Äôt allow New Mexicans like Paul to improve their lives through education after the age of 21.

shared_text:
New Mexico Human Rights Projects
January 28, 2019 at 5:12 PM ¬∑

NMHRP thanks Anne Frank House trainers who came to Albuquerque from Amsterdam, Costa Rica, South Carolina, and California this past weekend!

They trained students from the The New America School- Las Cruces, Bosque School, Sandia High School, La Cueva High School, East Mountain High School and Menaul School to be tour guides in their respective schools for the exhibit, Anne Frank: A History For Today.

After their intense training, our NM student guides are fully prepared to give impressive tours to not only their peers but to the general public on their community night.
http://nmhrp.org/events/anne-frank-a-history-for-today-exhibit-2/?fbclid=IwAR2b498VuDWaEStqAH38uj0a_fnME9I9lCM1vxTDEdDfd3iCg_PPMYj3-Dc

NMHRP is honored to be a partner of The Anne Frank House and thanks their trainers, Aaron Peterer, Morgan McCaskill, Gema Arrieta, and Mayra Aguilar for providing our NM students with an unforgettable experience.

post_text:
Laura Sandoval, a ninth grader at the New America School-Las Cruces, has been named Freshman of the Month for October 2018 by Dona Ana County.

Laura has an A grade point average and almost perfect attendance. She is a member of the yearbook staff, plays violin, and volunteers at her church‚Äôs daycare center. In addition, she participates in the Big Brothers/Big Sisters program.

A banner featuring Laura‚Äôs photo and biography will hang from the rotunda in the Government Center at 845 N. Motel Blvd. during the month of October.

Margarita Leza Porter, principal of the New America School-Las Cruces, said, ‚ÄúWe are very proud of Laura, a student who exemplifies the mission of our school.‚Äù

post_text:
We ROCK! New Mexico Secretary of Education Christopher Ruszkowski announced last week that the New America School-Las Cruces is one of the 10 highest-performing state charters in terms of growth (2015-2018) in English language arts. This is a major milestone and an important marker of the progress New America students are making. Mrs. Porter, principal of the school, said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so proud of our students and all the faculty and staff who have had an impact of their efforts. This is wonderful affirmation of the education we provide.‚Äù

The school is still accepting applications from new students for fall 2018. Registration for new and continuing students takes place on Thursday, August 2, 2018 from 8 am to 6 pm. Classes begin on Monday, August 6, 2018.

post_text: Margarita Leza Porter, principal of the New America School-Las Cruces, was named 2018 Educator of the Year Award in recognition of her outstanding leadership in education. Sponsored by the Las Cruces Hispanic Chamber of Commerce, Porter received her award at the organization's annual banquet held at the Hotel Encanto on February 9, 2018. In accepting the award, Porter said, "I was born and raised in Las Cruces and am filled with both joy and humility in being selected for this award. It is an honor and privilege to go to work every day with an amazing faculty and staff, a tremendous governing board, and the hard-working students who are flourishing in the innovative learning environment that the New America School provides."
text: Margarita Leza Porter, principal of the New America School-Las Cruces, was named 2018 Educator of the Year Award in recognition of her outstanding leadership in education. Sponsored by the Las Cruces Hispanic Chamber of Commerce, Porter received her award at the organization's annual banquet held at the Hotel Encanto on February 9, 2018. In accepting the award, Porter said, "I was born and raised in Las Cruces and am filled with both joy and humility in being selected for this award. It is an honor and privilege to go to work every day with an amazing faculty and staff, a tremendous governing board, and the hard-working students who are flourishing in the innovative learning environment that the New America School provides."

post_text:
Three New America High School students‚Äî William Horner, Angela Martinez, and Jordan Salcido traveled to Albuquerque yesterday as finalists in the NM Human Rights Projects essay
contest to participate in mock trials in Poland this November.
Mr. Ray, their faculty sponsor, reported that all three did exceedingly well. Late last night, Angela was informed that she had been selected to be part of the NM delegation (of eight students statewide). She's going to Poland! Jordan has been named an alternate. We are so proud of these students and their achievements.

(l-r): Cynthia Cockrell, Tifaney McKee, Julia Barela, Diana Guerrero-Baca, Alicia Demchok, Israel Montoya, and Edgar Nava.

OUTSTANDING STUDENTS HONORED
Las Cruces, NM, February 10, 2017 ‚Äì Cynthia Cockrell, Tifaney McKee, Julia Barela, Diana Guerrero-Baca, Alicia Demchok, Israel Montoya, and Edgar Nava were named ‚ÄúStudents of the Month‚Äù for February based on their superior grades and strong motivation to excel. They all have excellent attendance, are dedicated to their studies, and demonstrate high standards of conduct.

ABOUT THE NEW AMERICA SCHOOL
The New America School-Las Cruces (NAS-LC) is located in the heart of Las Cruces, NM and currently serves about 350 students. Established in 2012, the school‚Äôs mission is to ‚Äúempower new immigrants, English language learners, and the academically underserved with the educational tools and support they need to maximize their potential, succeed, and live the American Dream.‚Äù For more information, contact: Principal Margarita Porter at (575) 527-9085 or mporter@newamericaschoolnm.org.

post_text: Lucy Morales, Frances Gutierrez, Margarita Porter, Erica Olivas, Roberta Stathis, and Oscar Juarez (l-r in the photograph) participated in the recent ‚ÄúCommunity Forum,‚Äù which was on the NMSU campus. Four area legislators took questions from members of the Las Cruces community. There was a great turnout and a lively exchange of ideas. We were especially grateful to hear the legislators express a commitment to continuing the funding for high school students age 21 and older.
text: Lucy Morales, Frances Gutierrez, Margarita Porter, Erica Olivas, Roberta Stathis, and Oscar Juarez (l-r in the photograph) participated in the recent ‚ÄúCommunity Forum,‚Äù which was on the NMSU campus. Four area legislators took questions from members of the Las Cruces community. There was a great turnout and a lively exchange of ideas. We were especially grateful to hear the legislators express a commitment to continuing the funding for high school students age 21 and older.

post_text: Alright Class of 2016... Let's get those selfies in!!! Post a picture with your cap and gown! #NASLCGRADUATES2016
shared_text:
Lucy Alvillar Moralez is at The New America School- Las Cruces.
April 14, 2016 at 9:05 PM ¬∑ Las Cruces, NM ¬∑

Graduation finally!! It only took 28 years after dropping out of high school. Last fall I registered for high school at The New America High School in Las Cruces. Yes!! I finally went back to school, it's been a ruff year with so many obstacle but I kept going, I did so well in school this time around that I am the president of the Honors Society, yes you read that right Honors Society!! Wow.
I still can't believe it, I only have 4 weeks to go until graduation day, I always dreamed of one day earning my diploma and getting to walk in cap & gown and now I will. I want to thank everyone who supported me in this journey, I'm so proud of my self and all the adult student who attend The New America High School, we all took different road along our life, and then we some how ended up all wanting the same thing to earn our high school education, I love and thank this school, teachers and staff. Ooh I almost forgot I will be attending college in the fall!!

post_text: Way to go William!!!
shared_text:
LCSUN-NEWS.COM
Las Cruces student raising money for Cuba trip
text:
Way to go William!!!

LCSUN-NEWS.COM
Las Cruces student raising money for Cuba trip

post_text:
William, a sophomore at the New America School-Las Cruces, entered an essay contest expressing his views of the Cuban embargo. William‚Äôs winning essay was selected by the Albuquerque-based New Mexico Human Rights Projects! As a result, he will be part of a delegation of 10 NM students going to Cuba. This 10-day program will give William an opportunity to learn about a country in transition through lectures, site visits, community service projects, museums, nature hikes, and direct engagement with Cuban high school students.

Congratulations William!!! Please help our student raise funds for this great oppurtunity at gofundme.com/bv9tqjc4. All donations are greatly appreciated!
text:
William, a sophomore at the New America School-Las Cruces, entered an essay contest expressing his views of the Cuban embargo. William‚Äôs winning essay was selected by the Albuquerque-based New Mexico Human Rights Projects! As a result, he will be part of a delegation of 10 NM students going to Cuba. This 10-day program will give William an opportunity to learn about a country in transition through lectures, site visits, community service projects, museums, nature hikes, and direct engagement with Cuban high school students.

Congratulations William!!! Please help our student raise funds for this great oppurtunity at gofundme.com/bv9tqjc4. All donations are greatly appreciated!

post_text:
Don't forget! Pick up your schedules today and tomorrow!!! (see schedule below for pick-up hours)

Thursday, August 6th: 2pm- 7pm
Friday, August 7th: 8am- 5pm
First Day of classes: August 10th
***If you are under 18, parent or guardian must attend with you
***Over 18, please do not send someone else to pick up your schedule
***We will be taking ID pictures, so bring your smiles!

See you all soon!

post_text:
School starts in just 1 week!!! Don't forget to come this week to pick up your schedules! See information below for pick-up dates and times! See you then!!!

Thursday, August 6th: 2pm- 7pm
Friday, August 7th: 8am- 5pm
First Day of classes: August 10th
***If you are under 18, parent or guardian must attend with you
***Over 18, please do not send someone else to pick up your schedule
***We will be taking ID pictures, so bring your smiles!

If you have further questions, comment here or call our office at 575-527-9085! We are still enrolling so apply today!!!
